displayName: Ensure Asymmetric Key Size is set to 'greater than or equal to 2048' in non-system databases
rationale: The `RSA_2048` encryption algorithm for asymmetric keys in SQL Server is the highest bit-level provided and therefore the most secure available choice (other choices are `RSA_512` and `RSA_1024`).
recommended_action: Refer to Microsoft SQL Server Books Online ALTER ASYMMETRIC KEY entry: [https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/statements/alter-asymmetric-key-transact-sql](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/t-sql/statements/alter-asymmetric-key-transact-sql)
error_message: Asymmetric key size for one or more databases is noncompliant
ruleNames: Ensure Asymmetric Key Size is set to 'greater than or equal to 2048' in non-system databases
